    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(short localPort,
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.net.InetSocketAddress,ServentThread> neighbors,
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.net.InetSocketAddress> historyPing,
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.net.InetSocketAddress> historyQuery,
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Message> pendingMessages,
      java.net.InetAddress ipAddress,
      IdGenerator myIdGenerator,
      java.io.File myDirectory,
      byte[] idServent,
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.net.InetSocketAddress,ServentThread> downloads,
      java.util.ArrayList<QueryHitMessage> queryHitMessage)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a Client who manage sending/receiving Messages of the Gnutella protocol
        Parameters:
        localPort - * @param localPort Port in which the servent owner of this client works
        neighbors - HashMap that contains the connections to its neighbors nodes. Keys are in format InetSocketAddress, those InetSocketAddress are bound with each connection(ServentThread).
        historyPing - HashMap that contains de history of every PingMessage received from a neighbor Servent and every PingMessage generated by the Servent that owns this Server
        historyQuery - HashMap that contains de history of every QueryMessage received from a neighbor Servent and every QueryMessage generated by the Servent that owns this Server
        pendingMessages - Queue which contains every message that needs to be process by the Servent that owns this Server
        ipAddress - the ip address bound to this client
        myIdGenerator - Object to generate id
        myDirectory - DirectoryPath or file which, the Servent that owns this Server, shares with the network
        idServent - The 16-byte string uniquely identifying the servent on the network who is being requested to push
        downloads - HashMap that contains the connections to nodes which the Servent owner of this Server has request for downloads and connections to nodes that request for a download . Keys are in format InetSocketAddress, those InetSocketAddress are bound with each connection(ServentThread). Values are ServentThread.
        queryHitMessage - IO error when opening the socket in which this Server listens for upcoming connections
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public int getMaxNodes()

      • searchFile

        public byte searchFile(java.lang.String file)
        Search that in the directory of the Servent owner of this Client exists a file with the specified name or a the name is a substring of another
        Parameters:
        file - The name of the file to search
        Returns:
        number of times the file matches

      • createPing

        public PingMessage createPing()
        Returns a PingMessage. MessageID is randomly generated. Ttl value is set by default to 7, hop to 0
        Returns:
        the PingMessage

      • addAPing

        public void addAPing()
        Adds a PingMessage to the pending Message queue

      • addAQuery

        public void addAQuery(short minSpeed,
             java.lang.String searchCriteria)
        Adds a QuerMessage to the pending Message queue
        Parameters:
        minSpeed - The minimum speed (in kB/second) of servents that should respond to this message.
        searchCriteria - A nul (i.e. 0x00) terminated search string. The maximum length of this string is bounded by the Payload_Length field of the descriptor header.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

        Returns:

      • download

        public void download(java.lang.String ip,
            short port,
            java.lang.String file,
            int size,
            int range)
        Creates a download connection with a Server with the specified data
        Parameters:
        ip - The IP address of the responding host.
        port - The port number on which the responding host can accept incoming connections.
        file - The double-nul (i.e. 0x0000) terminated name of the file whose index is File_Index.
        size - The size (in bytes) of the file whose index is File_Index
        range - A number, assigned by the responding host, which is used to uniquely identify the file matching the corresponding query.

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String ip,
              short port)
        Creates a connection with to the specified port number at the specified IP address.
        Parameters:
        ip - the ip address
        port - the port number
        Returns:
        true if the connection is establish, otherwise false
